id.description: Unique ID of the item record

hrid.description: The human readable ID, also called eye readable ID. A system-assigned sequential alternate ID

holdingsRecordId.description: ID of the holdings record the item is a member of.

formerIds.description: Previous identifiers assigned to the item

discoverySuppress.description: Records the fact that the record should not be displayed in a discovery system

barcode.description: Unique inventory control number for physical resources, used largely for circulation purposes

effectiveShelvingOrder.description: A system generated normalization of the call number that allows for call number sorting in reports and search results

itemLevelCallNumber.description: Call Number is an identifier assigned to an item, usually printed on a label attached to the item. The call number is used to determine the items physical position in a shelving sequence, e.g. K1 .M44. The Item level call number, is the call number on item level.

itemLevelCallNumberPrefix.description: Prefix of the call number on the item level.

itemLevelCallNumberSuffix.description: Suffix of the call number on the item level.

itemLevelCallNumberTypeId.description: Identifies the source of the call number, e.g., LCC, Dewey, NLM, etc.

effectiveCallNumberComponents.description: Elements of a full call number generated from the item or holding

callNumber.description: Effective Call Number is an identifier assigned to an item or its holding and associated with the item.

prefix.description: Effective Call Number Prefix is the prefix of the identifier assigned to an item or its holding and associated with the item.

suffix.description: Effective Call Number Suffix is the suffix of the identifier assigned to an item or its holding and associated with the item.

typeId.description: Effective Call Number Type Id is the call number type id of the item, if available, otherwise that of the holding.

volume.description: Volume is intended for monographs when a multipart monograph (e.g. a biography of George Bernard Shaw in three volumes).

enumeration.description: Enumeration is the descriptive information for the numbering scheme of a serial.

chronology.description: Chronology is the descriptive information for the dating scheme of a serial.

yearCaption.description: In multipart monographs, a caption is a character(s) used to label a level of chronology, e.g., year 1985.

itemIdentifier.description: Item identifier number, e.g. imported from the union catalogue (read only).

copyNumber.description: Copy number is the piece identifier. The copy number reflects if the library has a copy of a single-volume monograph; one copy of a multi-volume, (e.g. Copy 1, or C.7.)

numberOfPieces.description: Number of pieces. Used when an item is checked out or returned to verify that all parts are present (e.g. 7 CDs in a set).

missingPiecesDate.description: Date when the piece(s) went missing.

itemDamagedStatusDate.description: Date and time when the item was damaged.

notes.description: Notes about action, copy, binding etc.

itemNoteTypeId.description: ID of the type of note

staffOnly.description: If true, determines that the note should not be visible for others than staff

circulationNotes.description: Notes to be displayed in circulation processes

id.description: The id of the circulation note

noteType.description: Type of circulation process that the note applies to

source.description: The user who added/updated the note. The property is generated by the server and needed to support sorting. Points to /users/{id} resource.

id.description: The id of the user who added/updated the note. The user information is generated by the server and needed to support sorting. Points to /users/{id} resource.

date.description: Date and time the record is added/updated. The property is generated by the server and needed to support sorting.

staffOnly.description: Flag to restrict display of this note

name.description: Name of the status e.g. Available, Checked out, In transit

date.description: Date and time when the status was last changed

materialTypeId.description: Material type, term. Define what type of thing the item is.

permanentLoanTypeId.description: The permanent loan type, is the default loan type for a given item. Loan types are tenant-defined.

temporaryLoanTypeId.description: Temporary loan type, is the temporary loan type for a given item.

permanentLocationId.description: Permanent item location is the default location, shelving location, or holding which is a physical place where items are stored, or an Online location.

permanentLocation.description: The permanent shelving location in which an item resides

temporaryLocationId.description: Temporary item location is the temporarily location, shelving location, or holding which is a physical place where items are stored, or an Online location.

temporaryLocation.description: Temporary location, shelving location, or holding which is a physical place where items are stored, or an Online location

effectiveLocationId.description: Read only current home location for the item.

electronicAccess.description: References for accessing the item by URL.

uri.description: uniform resource identifier (URI) is a string of characters designed for unambiguous identification of resources

linkText.description: the value of the MARC tag field 856 2nd indicator, where the values are: no information provided, resource, version of resource, related resource, no display constant generated

materialsSpecification.description: materials specified is used to specify to what portion or aspect of the resource the electronic location and access information applies (e.g. a portion or subset of the item is electronic, or a related electronic resource is being linked to the record)

publicNote.description: URL public note to be displayed in the discovery

relationshipId.description: relationship between the electronic resource at the location identified and the item described in the record as a whole

inTransitDestinationServicePointId.description: Service point an item is intended to be transited to (should only be present when in transit)

purchaseOrderLineIdentifier.description: ID referencing a remote purchase order object related to this item

tags.description: arbitrary tags associated with this item

holdingsRecord2.description: Fake property for mod-graphql to determine record relationships.

lastCheckIn.description: Information about when an item was last scanned in the Inventory app.

dateTime.description: Date and time of the last check in of the item.

servicePointId.description: Service point ID being used by a staff member when item was scanned in Check in app.

staffMemberId.description: ID a staff member who scanned the item
